intro: Xanthisma wigginsii, commonly known as the Wiggins' sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small yellow flowers in the spring. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Xanthisma wigginsii is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
